question: Blunt (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Direct and straightforward, often to the point of rudeness
answer: Direct and straightforward, often to the point of rudeness
explanation: She was too blunt when she said my presentation was boring. His blunt reply hurt my feelings. (Hindi: सीधा/रुखा)

question: Apprehension (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Anxiety or fear about something that may happen
answer: Anxiety or fear about something that may happen
explanation: I felt some apprehension before my first day at the new job. There was apprehension in the air as we waited for the test results. (Hindi: आशंका/घबराहट)

question: Furore (Meaning & Usage)
choices: An outbreak of public anger or excitement
answer: An outbreak of public anger or excitement
explanation: The new school rules caused a furore among students. There was a furore in the media about the politician's comments. (Hindi: हंगामा/उत्तेजना)

question: Formidable (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Inspiring fear or respect through being powerful or capable
answer: Inspiring fear or respect through being powerful or capable
explanation: The final exam was a formidable challenge for all the students. She is a formidable lawyer who has never lost a case. (Hindi: दबदबा/भयानक)

question: Propping (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He was propping the door open with a heavy book. The government is propping up the failing company with emergency funds. (Hindi: सहारा देना/टेक लगाना)

question: Condemn (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The mayor condemned the violence that broke out after the game. Many leaders condemned the attack on the hospital. (Hindi: निंदा करना/भर्त्सना करना)

question: Gauge (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: It's difficult to gauge how many people will attend the event. She tried to gauge his reaction by watching his face. (Hindi: आकलन करना/अंदाजा लगाना)

question: Critique (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The teacher will critique our essays during class tomorrow. I asked my friend to critique my presentation before the meeting. (Hindi: आलोचनात्मक समीक्षा करना)

question: Petition (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A formal written request signed by many people
answer: A formal written request signed by many people
explanation: They started a petition to save the local library from closing. The online petition gathered over ten thousand signatures. (Hindi: याचिका/अर्जी)

question: Sway (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Her powerful speech swayed many voters to support her campaign. The evidence presented in court swayed the jury's opinion. (Hindi: प्रभावित करना/मनाना)

question: Alleged (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Claimed to be true but not yet proven
answer: Claimed to be true but not yet proven
explanation: The alleged thief was arrested yesterday but hasn't gone to trial yet. The alleged sighting of a bear in the neighborhood turned out to be a large dog. (Hindi: कथित/अभिकथित)

question: Peculiar (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He has a peculiar habit of humming when he reads. There was a peculiar smell coming from the old refrigerator. (Hindi: अजीब/विचित्र)

question: Grievance (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The workers filed a grievance about their overtime pay. She had several grievances about how the project was managed. (Hindi: शिकायत/असंतोष)

question: Marsh (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A wet, muddy area of land
answer: A wet, muddy area of land
explanation: We saw many birds when we walked through the marsh. The marsh was filled with tall grasses and shallow water. (Hindi: दलदल/आर्द्रभूमि)

question: Boggle (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To astonish or overwhelm the mind
answer: To astonish or overwhelm the mind
explanation: The complexity of the math problem boggled the students. The sheer number of stars in the sky boggles the mind. (Hindi: हैरान करना/चकित करना)

question: Patriarch (Meaning & Usage)
choices: The male head of a family or tribe
answer: The male head of a family or tribe
explanation: The patriarch of the family made all the important decisions. Everyone gathered to celebrate the patriarch's 90th birthday. (Hindi: कुलपति/परिवार के मुखिया)

question: Hatch (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To break out of an egg
answer: To break out of an egg
explanation: We watched the baby chicks hatch from their eggs. The turtle eggs will hatch in about two months. (Hindi: अंडे से निकलना/सेने लगना)

question: Veil (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The morning fog began to veil the mountains in the distance. She wore a veil that covered her face during the ceremony. (Hindi: घूंघट/आवरण)

question: Rhetoric (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The politician's rhetoric inspired many young voters. Her speech was full of powerful rhetoric about equality. (Hindi: वाक्पटुता/भाषण कला)

question: Replicate (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Scientists tried to replicate the experiment's results. The artist could replicate any painting with perfect accuracy. (Hindi: प्रतिलिपि बनाना/दोहराना)

question: Overwhelm (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To make someone feel calm and relaxed
To give too much of something to someone
To help someone with a small task
answer: To give too much of something to someone
explanation: The teacher tried not to overwhelm the students with homework. The sudden news of the promotion overwhelmed him with emotion. (Hindi: अभिभूत करना/घेर लेना)

question: Cohesion (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The team's cohesion helped them win the championship. A good leader creates cohesion among team members. (Hindi: संसंजन/एकजुटता)

question: Arbitration (Meaning & Usage)
choices: The process of solving a disagreement outside of court
answer: The process of solving a disagreement outside of court
explanation: The two companies used arbitration to settle their contract dispute. Many employment contracts require arbitration instead of lawsuits. (Hindi: मध्यस्थता/पंचाट)

question: Abrogate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To officially cancel a law or agreement
answer: To officially cancel a law or agreement
explanation: The government decided to abrogate the old trade agreement. The new president moved to abrogate several international treaties. (Hindi: रद्द करना/अमान्य घोषित करना)

question: Envisage (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To imagine or form a mental picture of something
answer: To imagine or form a mental picture of something
explanation: It's hard to envisage what life will be like in 50 years. The architect envisaged a modern building with lots of glass. (Hindi: कल्पना करना/विचार करना)

question: Lampoon (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The comedy show lampooned the president's speaking style. The cartoon lampooned the company's failed product launch. (Hindi: व्यंग्य करना/मजाक उड़ाना)

question: Mock (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To make fun of or tease
answer: To make fun of or tease
explanation: The other children mocked him for his unusual haircut. She mocked his attempt to cook dinner. (Hindi: मजाक उड़ाना/नकल उतारना)

question: Lament (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: She lamented the loss of her favorite childhood park. He lamented that he had not studied harder for the exam. (Hindi: विलाप करना/शोक व्यक्त करना)

question: Persuade (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To force someone to do something
To convince someone to do something
answer: To convince someone to do something
explanation: She persuaded her friends to come to the party. He persuaded his boss to give him a raise. (Hindi: मनाना/राजी करना)

question: Indignation (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He felt great indignation when he saw someone cutting in line. Her voice was full of indignation as she described the unfair treatment. (Hindi: रोष/क्रोध)

question: Robust (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The old bridge was surprisingly robust after all these years. She has a robust immune system that fights off colds easily. (Hindi: मजबूत/स्वस्थ)

question: Perplex (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The complicated instructions perplexed the new students. His strange behavior perplexed his friends. (Hindi: हैरान करना/उलझाना)

question: Inflammatory (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The politician's inflammatory speech caused protests in the streets. His inflammatory comments made the argument worse. (Hindi: भड़काऊ/उत्तेजक)

question: Voyage (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A long journey by sea or space
answer: A long journey by sea or space
explanation: The ship began its voyage across the Atlantic Ocean. The astronauts prepared for their voyage to the moon. (Hindi: समुद्री यात्रा/सफर)

question: Fateful (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: It was a fateful decision that changed his life forever. Their fateful meeting led to a lifelong friendship. (Hindi: भाग्यवादी/निर्णायक)

question: Semblance (Meaning & Usage)
choices: An outward appearance that may be false
answer: An outward appearance that may be false
explanation: She tried to maintain a semblance of calm during the crisis. The town returned to some semblance of normalcy after the storm. (Hindi: दिखावा/ऊपरी आकार)

question: Conspiracy (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A secret plan to do something harmful
answer: A secret plan to do something harmful
explanation: The police discovered a conspiracy to rob the bank. He believed in a conspiracy to hide the truth about the incident. (Hindi: साजिश/षड्यंत्र)

question: Prerequisite (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Something that happens after an event
Something required before something else can happen
answer: Something required before something else can happen
explanation: Passing the basic course is a prerequisite for the advanced class. A driver's license is a prerequisite for delivering pizzas. (Hindi: पूर्वापेक्षा/शर्त)

question: Repercussions (Meaning & Usage)
choices: The immediate causes of an event
The unintended consequences of an action
The planned outcomes of a project
The main benefits of a decision
answer: The unintended consequences of an action
explanation: He didn't consider the repercussions of skipping his final exam. The new law had serious repercussions for small business owners. (Hindi: प्रतिक्रिया/नतीजे)

question: Futility (Meaning & Usage)
choices: The quality of being highly effective
The pointlessness or uselessness of an effort
The great importance of a task
answer: The pointlessness or uselessness of an effort
explanation: He soon realized the futility of arguing with his stubborn friend. She felt the futility of trying to clean during the dust storm. (Hindi: व्यर्थता/निरर्थकता)

question: Maul (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The bear began to maul the hiker who got too close. The critics mauled the author's new book in their reviews. (Hindi: क्षत-विक्षत करना/जख्मी करना)

question: Virulent (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The patient contracted a virulent strain of the flu. She faced virulent criticism for her controversial opinions. (Hindi: विषैला/घातक)

question: Savage (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The savage storm destroyed several homes along the coast. The boxer launched a savage attack in the final round. (Hindi: जंगली/क्रूर)

question: Severe (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The drought caused severe water shortages in the region. He received a severe punishment for breaking the rules. (Hindi: गंभीर/कठोर)

question: Embolden (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To give someone courage or confidence
answer: To give someone courage or confidence
explanation: Her early success emboldened her to try more difficult challenges. The supportive crowd emboldened the shy singer. (Hindi: प्रोत्साहित करना/हिम्मत बढ़ाना)

question: Proponent (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A person who is against something
A person who supports a cause or idea
answer: A person who supports a cause or idea
explanation: She is a strong proponent of renewable energy sources. He was a leading proponent of the new education policy. (Hindi: समर्थक/पक्षधर)

question: Promulgate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To promote or make widely known
answer: To promote or make widely known
explanation: The government promulgated the new safety regulations. The company promulgated its values through training sessions. (Hindi: घोषणा करना/प्रचार करना)

question: Wreck (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The hurricane could wreck the small coastal town. One mistake could wreck his chances of getting the job. (Hindi: नष्ट करना/बर्बाद करना)

question: Evict (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To force someone to leave a property
answer: To force someone to leave a property
explanation: The landlord had to evict the tenants for not paying rent. They were evicted from their apartment after many complaints. (Hindi: बेदखल करना/निकालना)

question: Aggregate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To collect or combine into a whole
To reduce in size or amount
answer: To collect or combine into a whole
explanation: The app aggregates news from many different sources. We need to aggregate all the data before we can analyze it. (Hindi: एकत्र करना/संग्रह करना)

question: Lucrative (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Producing a great deal of profit
answer: Producing a great deal of profit
explanation: He left his job for a more lucrative position at a tech company. Selling handmade crafts online became a lucrative business for her. (Hindi: लाभदायक/फायदेमंद)

question: Encroach (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To gradually intrude on someone's territory or rights
To protect an area from outsiders
answer: To gradually intrude on someone's territory or rights
explanation: The construction began to encroach on the protected forest land. She felt her boss was encroaching on her personal time with constant emails. (Hindi: अतिक्रमण करना/अतिक्रमण करना)

question: Culminate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To reach the highest point or final stage
answer: To reach the highest point or final stage
explanation: Years of hard work culminated in her winning the championship. The festival will culminate with a fireworks display on Saturday night. (Hindi: पराकाष्ठा पर पहुँचना/समापन होना)

question: Quip (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He made a quip about the weather that made everyone laugh. Her quick quip at the meeting lightened the mood in the room. (Hindi: चुटकुला/हाजिरजवाबी)

question: Astute (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The astute investor sold his stocks before the market crashed. Her astute observation helped solve the mystery quickly. (Hindi: चतुर/तीक्ष्णबुद्धि)

question: Incessant (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The incessant rain forced the cancellation of the outdoor event. He was annoyed by the incessant barking of the neighbor's dog. (Hindi: निरंतर/लगातार)

question: Akin (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His dedication to his work is akin to that of an artist. The feeling of relief was akin to winning a major prize. (Hindi: समान/संबंधित)

question: Sanguinary (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The sanguinary battle left the battlefield covered in bodies. The history book described the sanguinary conflict in great detail. (Hindi: रक्तरंजित/खूनी)

question: Bias (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A preference or prejudice for or against something
answer: A preference or prejudice for or against something
explanation: The judge had a bias toward harsher punishments for young offenders. Her bias against modern art made her dislike the exhibition. (Hindi: पक्षपात/झुकाव)

question: Prejudice (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A preconceived opinion not based on reason
answer: A preconceived opinion not based on reason
explanation: He faced prejudice because of his foreign accent. The hiring manager showed prejudice against candidates from certain schools. (Hindi: पूर्वाग्रह/धारणा)

question: Stereotype (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A widely held but oversimplified idea about a group
answer: A widely held but oversimplified idea about a group
explanation: The movie challenged the stereotype that athletes are not intelligent. She rejected the stereotype that women are bad drivers. (Hindi: रूढ़िवादी धारणा/छवि)

question: Abrupt (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The meeting came to an abrupt end when the fire alarm sounded. His abrupt reply made it clear he was not in a good mood. (Hindi: अचानक/आकस्मिक)

question: Ambiguity (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The ambiguity in the instructions led to several different interpretations. There was some ambiguity about when the project was actually due. (Hindi: अस्पष्टता/द्वयर्थकता)

question: Chauvinist (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A person who believes in equality
A person showing excessive loyalty to their group
answer: A person showing excessive loyalty to their group
explanation: He was a male chauvinist who believed women should not work. His national chauvinism made him dismiss other countries' achievements. (Hindi: अतिराष्ट्रवादी/समूहवादी)

question: Bigot (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A person who is intolerant of different opinions
Someone who easily changes their views
A person who respects all cultures
answer: A person who is intolerant of different opinions
explanation: The bigot refused to listen to any opposing viewpoints. She was called a bigot for her hateful comments about immigrants. (Hindi: कट्टरपंथी/धर्मांध)

question: Misogynist (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A person who loves and respects women
A person who hates or prejudices against women
A strong supporter of women's rights
answer: A person who hates or prejudices against women
explanation: The manager was a known misogynist who rarely promoted female employees. His misogynist comments during the meeting shocked everyone. (Hindi: स्त्रीद्वेषी/नारी विरोधी)

question: Obnoxious (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The obnoxious customer shouted at the cashier for no reason. His obnoxious behavior at the party made everyone uncomfortable. (Hindi: अप्रिय/घृणित)

question: Colloquial (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The author used colloquial language to make the story feel realistic. 'What's up?' is a colloquial way to say hello to friends. (Hindi: बोलचाल की भाषा/अनौपचारिक)

question: Acquiesce (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: She finally acquiesced to their demands after hours of discussion. He acquiesced and let his children stay up late on the weekend. (Hindi: मौन स्वीकृति देना/मान लेना)

question: Reluctant (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He was reluctant to try the strange-looking food. She gave a reluctant apology after being pressured by her friends. (Hindi: अनिच्छुक/हिचकिचाने वाला)

question: Amnesty (Meaning & Usage)
choices: An official pardon for people convicted of political offenses
answer: An official pardon for people convicted of political offenses
explanation: The government granted amnesty to all political prisoners. The new president declared amnesty for students who protested peacefully. (Hindi: आम माफी/क्षमादान)

question: Atrocity (Meaning & Usage)
choices: An extremely wicked or cruel act
answer: An extremely wicked or cruel act
explanation: The world condemned the atrocity against civilian populations. Survivors described the atrocities they witnessed during the war. (Hindi: अमानवीयता/क्रूरता)

question: Annihilation (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The hurricane caused the annihilation of several coastal villages. The general spoke of the annihilation of enemy forces. (Hindi: संहार/विनाश)

question: Sedition (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Conduct or speech inciting rebellion against authority
answer: Conduct or speech inciting rebellion against authority
explanation: He was arrested for sedition after calling for the government's overthrow. The speech was considered an act of sedition against the state. (Hindi: राजद्रोह/विद्रोह)

question: Resurgence (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A rising again to life, use, or prominence
answer: A rising again to life, use, or prominence
explanation: There has been a resurgence of interest in vinyl records recently. The team hopes for a resurgence after their losing streak. (Hindi: पुनरुत्थान/फिर से उभरना)

question: Nascent (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Just coming into existence and beginning to develop
answer: Just coming into existence and beginning to develop
explanation: The nascent democracy faced many challenges in its first year. She showed nascent talent in painting at a very young age. (Hindi: नवजात/उभरता हुआ)

question: Amicable (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The divorce was surprisingly amicable and both parties remained friends. They reached an amicable agreement without going to court. (Hindi: मैत्रीपूर्ण/दोस्ताना)

question: Affable (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Friendly and easy to talk to
answer: Friendly and easy to talk to
explanation: The affable shopkeeper always had a smile for his customers. She was so affable that strangers often shared their stories with her. (Hindi: मिलनसार/भद्र)

question: Gregarious (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His gregarious nature made him popular at social gatherings. Gregarious people often become event planners or teachers. (Hindi: मिलनसार/सामाजिक)

question: Ineffable (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Too great to be expressed in words
answer: Too great to be expressed in words
explanation: The beauty of the sunset was ineffable, leaving them speechless. She felt an ineffable joy when she held her newborn baby. (Hindi: अवर्णनीय/अकथनीय)

question: Reticent (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He was reticent about his personal life with coworkers. The reticent student rarely spoke in class discussions. (Hindi: अल्पभाषी/संकोची)

question: Garrulous (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The garrulous taxi driver talked throughout the entire ride. Her garrulous aunt could talk for hours without stopping. (Hindi: बातूनी/वाचाल)

question: Aesthetic (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The room's aesthetic was modern and minimalist. She had a great aesthetic sense in her fashion choices. (Hindi: सौंदर्यात्मक/कलात्मक)

question: Lethargic (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The hot weather made everyone feel lethargic and unmotivated. After the big meal, he felt too lethargic to exercise. (Hindi: सुस्त/निष्क्रिय)

question: Profound (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The book had a profound impact on her worldview. He felt profound gratitude for their help during difficult times. (Hindi: गहरा/गंभीर)

question: Pragmatic (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Her pragmatic approach solved the budget problem efficiently. He took a pragmatic view of the business challenge. (Hindi: व्यावहारिक/यथार्थवादी)

question: Superficial (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Their friendship was superficial and based only on shared hobbies. He suffered only superficial wounds in the accident. (Hindi: सतही/ऊपरी)

question: Contempt (Meaning & Usage)
choices: The feeling that someone is worthless
answer: The feeling that someone is worthless
explanation: She looked at the thief with contempt after learning his crimes. He felt nothing but contempt for people who cheat others. (Hindi: घृणा/तिरस्कार)

question: Magnificent (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The magnificent palace attracted tourists from around the world. She looked magnificent in her wedding dress. (Hindi: शानदार/भव्य)

question: Magnanimous (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The magnanimous winner praised his opponent's performance. Her magnanimous donation saved the community center. (Hindi: उदार/दयालु)

question: Apathy (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Student apathy toward the election concerned the teachers. His apathy about his health worried his family. (Hindi: उदासीनता/अरुचि)

question: Verbose (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The verbose speaker went far over his time limit. Her verbose writing style made the report difficult to read. (Hindi: वाचाल/शब्दाडंबरपूर्ण)

question: Utopian (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His utopian vision of world peace ignored human nature. The plan sounded utopian but failed to consider real-world challenges. (Hindi: आदर्शवादी/काल्पनिक)

question: Idealistic (Meaning & Usage)
choices: Having high moral principles that may not be practical
answer: Having high moral principles that may not be practical
explanation: Her idealistic plan to end poverty was noble but unrealistic. He was idealistic about changing the world when he was young. (Hindi: आदर्शवादी/सिद्धांतवादी)

question: Lynch (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To kill someone without legal trial, especially by a mob
answer: To kill someone without legal trial, especially by a mob
explanation: The angry mob threatened to lynch the accused man without any evidence. In history, people were often lynched by violent crowds acting as judge and executioner. (Hindi: भीड़ द्वारा अवैध हत्या करना)

question: Recital (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The young pianist gave her first recital at the community hall. We attended a beautiful dance recital last weekend. (Hindi: संगीत या नृत्य प्रदर्शन/गायन)

question: Corroborate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To confirm or give support to evidence
answer: To confirm or give support to evidence
explanation: The new evidence corroborated the witness's story. We need another source to corroborate these findings. (Hindi: पुष्टि करना/समर्थन करना)

question: Amendment (Meaning & Usage)
choices: A minor change or addition to improve something
answer: A minor change or addition to improve something
explanation: They proposed an amendment to the company's policy. The constitution has several important amendments. (Hindi: संशोधन/सुधार)

question: Spartan (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The spartan room contained only a bed and a desk. He lived a spartan lifestyle with very few possessions. (Hindi: सादा/कठोर)

question: Besmirch (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He tried to besmirch his opponent's character with false accusations. The scandal besmirched the company's good name. (Hindi: बदनाम करना/कलंक लगाना)

question: Insipid (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The soup was insipid and needed more seasoning. She found the movie insipid and boring. (Hindi: फीका/नीरस)

question: Inkling (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: I had an inkling that he would be late again. She gave no inkling of her plans to resign. (Hindi: आभास/संकेत)

question: Stolid (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He remained stolid throughout the crisis. Her stolid expression hid her true feelings. (Hindi: भावशून्य/अटल)

question: Indolent (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His indolent attitude frustrated his teachers. She spent an indolent afternoon on the sofa. (Hindi: आलसी/सुस्त)

question: Imbecile (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He called the driver an imbecile for the dangerous mistake. Only an imbecile would take such a risk. (Hindi: मूर्ख/बेवकूफ)

question: Hardihood (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: She showed great hardihood in facing the challenge. His hardihood impressed everyone during the crisis. (Hindi: साहस/दृढ़ता)

question: Conflate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To combine two ideas into one
answer: To combine two ideas into one
explanation: People often conflate wealth with happiness. He conflated two different historical events in his speech. (Hindi: मिलाना/सम्मिश्रण करना)

question: Pecuniary (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He had pecuniary difficulties after losing his job. The decision was based on pecuniary considerations. (Hindi: आर्थिक/धन संबंधी)

question: Mercenary (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His mercenary attitude made him unpopular. The soldier was a mercenary fighting for money. (Hindi: धनलोलुप/किराये का)

question: Repudiate (Meaning & Usage)
choices: To refuse to accept or reject something
answer: To refuse to accept or reject something
explanation: She repudiated the accusations against her. The company repudiated the contract. (Hindi: अस्वीकार करना/त्यागना)

question: Patronize (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He patronized her by explaining simple concepts. I hate when people patronize me. (Hindi: दंभपूर्ण व्यवहार करना)

question: Reticent (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He was reticent about his personal life. The reticent student rarely participated in class. (Hindi: अल्पभाषी/संकोची)

question: Ignominy (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: He suffered the ignominy of public failure. The scandal brought ignominy to the family. (Hindi: अपमान/बदनामी)

question: Exorbitant (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The hotel charged exorbitant prices. She paid an exorbitant amount for the concert tickets. (Hindi: अत्यधिक/बहुत ज्यादा)

question: Scourge (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Poverty remains a scourge in many countries. The disease was a scourge to the community. (Hindi: अभिशाप/संकट)

question: Conform (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: Students must conform to the school dress code. He refused to conform to social expectations. (Hindi: अनुरूप होना/मानना)

question: Cliche (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The speech was full of cliches about hard work. Their love story was a romantic cliche. (Hindi: घिसा-पीटा वाक्य/साधारण)

question: Nimble (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: The nimble athlete easily avoided the defenders. Her nimble fingers worked quickly. (Hindi: फुर्तीला/चुस्त)

question: Milieu (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: She grew up in an artistic milieu. The novel captures the political milieu of the 1960s. (Hindi: परिवेश/माहौल)

question: Self-effacing (Meaning & Usage)
explanation: His self-effacing manner made him popular. She was self-effacing about her achievements. (Hindi: आत्म-गोपनशील/विनम्र)
